sentences.en: Edwin H. Conger was envoy extraordinary and Minister Plenipotentiary.
sentences.cn: 埃德温·H.康格是特命全权公使。

sentences.en: Environmental groups have given a guarded welcome to the Prime Minister's proposal.
sentences.cn: 环保组织对首相的提议表示谨慎的欢迎.

sentences.en: He concluded a deal with the Danish minister in Washington.
sentences.cn: 他在华盛顿与丹麦公使达成了一项协议。

sentences.en: He is too impulsive to be a responsible prime minister.
sentences.cn: 他容易冲动，很难成为值得依赖的首相。

sentences.en: He put the case to the Saudi Foreign Minister.
sentences.cn: 他把这起事件向沙特外长作了说明。

sentences.en: His proposals have already been rebuffed by the Prime Minister.
sentences.cn: 他的提议已经被首相否决了。

sentences.en: Sir Geoffrey had no personal animosity towards the Prime Minister.
sentences.cn: 杰弗里爵士对首相并无私人恩怨。

sentences.en: The carpet was a wedding present from the Prime Minister.
sentences.cn: 这张地毯是首相送的结婚礼物。

sentences.en: The extremists prevailed, and the security minister was canned.
sentences.cn: 极端主义分子猖獗，致使安全部长被解职。

sentences.en: The industry minister described the affair as "an absolute scandal".
sentences.cn: 工业部长将此事件形容为“绝对的丑闻”。

sentences.en: The minister denied there was a direct connection between the two issues.
sentences.cn: 部长否认两者之间有直接的联系。

sentences.en: The Prime Minister has been briefed by her parliamentary aides.
sentences.cn: 首相已听取了她议会助手的简要汇报。

sentences.en: The Prime Minister has called an emergency meeting of parliament.
sentences.cn: 首相已召集议会召开紧急会议。

sentences.en: The Prime Minister has promised that Israel will play a constructive role.
sentences.cn: 首相承诺以色列将发挥积极的作用。

sentences.en: The Prime Minister has the power to dismiss and appoint senior ministers.
sentences.cn: 首相有权任免高级部长。

sentences.en: The Prime Minister was speaking ahead of today's meeting.
sentences.cn: 首相在今天的会议开始之前作了发言。

words.tran_cn: 部长的；内阁的；公使的；牧师的

trans.tran_en: a politician who is in charge of a government depart-ment, in Britain and some other countries

trans.tran_cn: 满足(…的需要)，照料，当牧师
